title: Drawing, "Sepulchral monument for writer Zacharia", after 1795
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite, on paper
markings:
Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457e)
Watermrk: I BOUCHER
provenance: Ex collection: Giovanni Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description:
Obliquely and incompletely shown. A base with the inscription between festoons, at the front side; a relief of a procession of women at the lateral side. 

Inscription:
QUI.GIACE.ZACHARIA.BRAVO/ SCRITTORE.CHE.IN.TUTTO/ IL.MONDO.CONCITO.SI.RESE

An urn tops a sphere, covered by clouds at bottom. Genii with trumpets sit crosswise at the corners on top of the clouds.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Sepulchral monument for writer Zacharia", after 1795.
after 1795. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite, on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-276.
